loading_screen_offline: به نظر می‌رسد شما آفلاین هستید. لطفا به اینترنت متصل شده و سپس دوباره تلاش کنید.
loading_screen_update: نسخه جدید LiteCord در دسترس است. لطفا به آخرین نسخه بروزرسانی کنید.
setup_question1: انتخاب کنید که چگونه میخواهید نصب کنید:
setup_offline: به نظر می‌رسد شما آفلاین هستید. لطفا به اینترنت وصل شده و سپس نصب LiteCord را از ابتدا شروع کنید.
setup_question3: آیا میخواهید LiteCord تغییرات کلاینت را خودکار اعمال کند؟
setup_question4: نوع اصلاح‌ساز برنامه که میخواهید نصب کنید انتخاب کنید:
settings-theme-desc1: LiteCord "themes" manage apps behaviour and looks.
settings-theme-desc2:
this is how LiteCord looks when you first launch it. It includes recreation of Discord's
                custom titlebar and LiteCord specific styles injected into Discord.
settings-tray-desc:
When disabled, LiteCord will close like any other window when closed, otherwise it'll sit back and relax
                in your system tray for later.
settings-patches-desk:
Fetches automatic patches that are distributed if release turns out to have bugs after release. Usually
                you don't have to keep this enabled, unless notified in support Discord.
settings-channel-desc4: public test build. Receives features earlier than stable but is a bit older than Canary.
settings-invitewebsocket-desc:
When enabled LiteCord will support Discord.gg links which means that if you open an invite link in your
                browser, LiteCord will automatically accept the invite. Can be unresponsive at times.
settings-altPaste-desc:
If you're on Gnome on Linux or just simply can't paste images copied from other messages, then this is
                for you. This enables alternative module for pasting images. Only enable this when you're experiencing
                issues.
settings-mod-desc1:
Client mods are programs that allow you customize your Discord experience. They can change appearance of
                the client, modify behaviours or add new features!
settings-theme-desc3:
uses native titlebar of OS you're currently running (e.g Windows 7/10). Functions more
                similar to actual Discord app on Linux.
settings-csp-desc:
LiteCord CSP is our system that manages loading custom content loading into the Discord app. Stuff like
                client mods and themes depend on it. Disable if you want to get rid of mods and custom styles.
settings-mobileMode-desc:
This blocks typing request and more Soon,
By Default 
 https://*/api/v*/science 
 https://sentry.io/* 
 https://*.nel.cloudflare.com/* Are blocked as in they are trackers, To enhance privacy enable this.
settings-channel-desc1: You can use this setting to change current instance of Discord:
settings-channel-desc2:
you're probably most familiar with this one. It's the one you see in default Discord
                    client!
settings-channel-desc3:
this is alpha test release of Discord. By using it you gain access to the newest
                    features and fixes.
settings-trayIcon-desc: Set the icon which will appear in tray menu.
settings-mod-vencord: lightweight, and easy to use client mod. Features a built-in store for plugins.
settings-mod-shelter: is a new generation client mod built to be essentially bulletproof.
settings-prfmMode-desc:
Performance mode is an experimental function that may either increase responsiveness and performance of
                LiteCord or... decrease it. Please try every option and see which fits you the best.
settings-skipSplash-desc: Skips LiteCord splash screen when you start up the app.
settings-startMinimized-desc: LiteCord starts in background and remains out of your way.
settings-useLegacyCapturer-desc: Use legacy screenshare module, instead of the new one. If you're experiencing issues with screen sharing, try enabling this.
settings-dynamicIcon-desc: Following Discord's behaviour on Windows, this shows unread messages/pings count on LiteCord's icon instead of it's tray.
settings-spellcheck-desc: Helps you correct misspelled words by highlighting them.
setup_question5: Do you want to use a tray icon?
settings-mintoTray-desc:
When disabled, LiteCord will close like any other window when closed, otherwise it'll sit back and relax
                in your system tray for later.
settings-theme-desc4: transparent window with native titlebar, you need a compatible theme to run this. Windows only.
